<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ConsoleTask_Entry:
```c
static void *OS_ConsoleTask_Entry(void *arg)
{
    OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t           local_arg;
    OS_impl_console_internal_record_t *local;
    OS_object_token_t                  token;

    /* cppcheck-suppress unreadVariable // intentional use of other union member */
    local_arg.opaque_arg = arg;
    if (OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_REFCOUNT, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE, local_arg.id, &token) == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        local = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_console_table, token);

        /* Loop forever (unless shutdown is set) */
        while (OS_SharedGlobalVars.GlobalState != OS_SHUTDOWN_MAGIC_NUMBER)
        {
            OS_ConsoleOutput_Impl(&token);
            sem_wait(&local->data_sem);
        }
        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }
    return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_ConsoleTask_Entry:
typedef union
{
    void *           opaque_arg;
    OS_ArgCallback_t arg_callback_func;
    osal_id_t        id;
    osal_index_t     idx;
} OS_VoidPtrValueWrapper_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    sem_t data_sem;
} OS_impl_console_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_console_internal_record_t OS_impl_console_table[OS_MAX_CONSOLES]
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
local_arg.opaque_arg = arg;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The function parameter is the thread-entry void *arg (API-defined non-const) and it is copied into a union member of type void *. The code does not dereference or modify the pointee; the union is used to reinterpret the value as an id. Because the pointer is an opaque thread argument (and the thread API mandates void *), there is no opportunity or requirement to qualify it const here. If instead the code dereferenced the pointer and modified the referenced object without const qualification, or if a pointer-to-object that is not modified could be declared const but was not, that would be a violation.
